newsitem.title: NORWAY: Statoil seals LPG deal with Turkey.
newsitem.headline: Statoil seals LPG deal with Turkey.

text.p: Den norske stats oljeselskap AS has sealed its first contract with Turkey to deliver liquefied petroleum gas (LPG) to state-owned energy group Tupras, a company spokeswoman said on Tuesday.
The contract runs for one year and shipments will be made by Norwegian shipowner Bergesen ASA.
No further details were available on the deal, which marks the opening of a fourth avenue for Statoil to market LPG, company spokeswoman Berit Rynning Oeyen told Reuters.
Statoil already sells LPG to northwest Europe, the Mediterranean and the United States.
"Being an actor in several (LPG) markets gives us a great advantage," Oeyen said. "We will look to develop other markets if the opportunity and the price is there."
The state-owned oil company expects to see rising volumes of LPG and condensate at the Kaarstoe terminal on the west coast of Norway as developments such as Aasgard are brought on stream.
Kaarstoe currently processes around two million tonnes per year of LPG and 1.3 million tonnes per year of condensate.
